arm_group.description: Intervention type: Telephone support for four months.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether phone use contributes to diabetes control.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telephone Use for Care of Persons With Diabetes Mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
Studies reinforce the need to test innovative care that can serve more patients, since
      education is a key element for the accession to the treatment of diabetes. Recently, an
      innovative, feasible and low cost presented in the literature is the use of telephone
      support as an intervention strategy This study aims to evaluate the implementation of a
      telephone support for self-monitoring of people with diabetes mellitus treated in ribeirão
      Preto.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  diabetes mellitus type 2

          -  age

          -  ability to listen and answer questions

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  often present less than 75% participation in the proposed activities

intervention.description: Telephone support for four months about healthy diet, physical activity and medication use.

link.description: Affiliated to the International Diabetes Federation.

facility.name: University of São Paulo at Ribeirão Preto College of Nursing

clinical_study.official_title: Telephone Support for Self-monitoring of Persons With Diabetes Mellitus Using the Chronic Care Model

overall_official.affiliation: University of São Paulo at Ribeirão Preto College of Nursing

primary_outcome.measure: Telephone Support for self-monitoring of persons with diabetes mellitus using the Chronic Care Model

responsible_party.investigator_title: Telephone Support for self-monitoring of persons with diabetes mellitus
